name: Draft genome sequences of Vibrio sp. isolates from across the United States closely related to Vibrio cholerae

description: We are reporting whole genome sequences of nine Vibrio sp. isolates, closely related to the waterborne human pathogen Vibrio cholerae. These isolates were recovered from human and environmental samples from different parts of United States. Genome analysis suggests this group of isolates represents a potentially novel species within the genus Vibrio.

citation.text: Tarequl, M. et al 2018. Draft genome sequences of nine Vibrio sp. clinical isolates from across the United States representing the closest known relative of Vibrio cholerae. MRA. In review.

distribution.name: Vibrio_sp_1000BTS_MLtree.pdf
distribution.description: 1000 Bootstrap tree raxml maximum likelihood tree.

distribution.name: Vibrio_sp_100BTS_tree.pdf
distribution.description: Maximum likelihood tree with representative Vibrio cholerae strains and the nine Vibrio sp. isolates.

distribution.name: Vibrio_sp_ANI_DDH_values.xlsx
distribution.description: Average Nucleotide Identity (ANI) and inSilco DNA-DNA Hybridization (isDDH) values for all nine Vibrio sp. isolates and representative Vibrio cholerae strains
